verb.description: Become aware or conscious of (something); come to realize or understand.
examples: his mouth fell open as he perceived the truth
he was quick to perceive that there was little future in such arguments

verb.description: Interpret or look on (someone or something) in a particular way; regard as.
examples: if Guy does not perceive himself as disabled, nobody else should
some geographers perceive hydrology to be a separate field of scientific inquiry

origin: Middle English: from a variant of Old French perçoivre, from Latin percipere seize, understand, from per- entirely + capere take.
